Dried moxa herb (a mugwort) is burned usually just above but sometimes directly on the skin over acupuncture points. The herb may be in the form of incense sticks or wool. Moxibustion is used to treat conditions similar to those treated with [acupuncture](/en-pr/home/special-subjects/integrative-complementary-and-alternative-medicine/acupuncture) [ Acupuncture Acupuncture, a therapy within traditional Chinese medicine, is one of the most widely accepted CAM therapies in the Western world. Licensed practitioners do not necessarily have a medical degree... read more ](/en-pr/home/special-subjects/integrative-complementary-and-alternative-medicine/acupuncture) . Moxibustion can cause circular burns (which resemble burns from cigarette tips) and blisters.
